title: Health Game-Based Microlearning Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners possess advanced knowledge in science, requiring individualized learning experiences in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners develop a prototype of a health-promotion educational game within a week by applying persuasive game design principles (e.g., motivation, feedback, gradual difficulty), and submit a result that meets four or more of five predefined evaluation checklist criteria (functionality, educational value, user experience).
Compare and analyze at least three intrinsic/extrinsic game mechanics tailored for medical purposes (health promotion/disease management)
Design a peer support system utilizing mobile-optimized microlearning activities (5-minute units)

resources: Game Development Tools (e.g., Unity/Unreal Engine Educational Licenses)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
